text: The Five-storied pagoda of Ryongtongsa Buddhist temple is listed as a National Treasure of North Korea. The pagoda is 6.48 m high, built with "well-trimmed granite stones" on a platform with a width of 3.23 m. Dating from the Koryo Dynasty, it is located 10 km north of Kaesong. The KCNA describes it as representative of "the high architecture in the early days of the Koryo Dynasty." == References == Category:Korean pagodas Category:Stone pagodas Category:National Treasures of North Korea Category:Pagodas in North Korea Category:Buildings and structures in North Hwanghae Province
title: Five-storied pagoda of Ryongtongsa Buddhist temple
